reference.title: Starting Motor and Generator Lubrication
reference.shortdesc: The starting motor and generator use both automatic splash lubrication and manual oiling systems for maintenance.

section.title: Starting Motor Lubrication
section.p: The starting motor uses the splash system, which provides lubrication through:

ul.li: The same splash system that lubricates the engine
The same splash system that lubricates the transmission

section.title: Generator Lubrication
section.p: The generator receives lubrication through two methods:

ul.li: Primary lubrication from oil splash from the time gears
Supplementary lubrication via an oil cup located at the end of the generator housing, which requires occasional manual oil drops
